newsitem.title: USA: Lilly meets Q3 consensus before Dura gain.
newsitem.headline: Lilly meets Q3 consensus before Dura gain.

text.p: Eli Lilly & Co met Wall Street expectations in the third quarter by posting profits of $0.64 per share, excluding a one-time gain on the sale of U.S. marketing rights for two aging antibiotics.

The company reported quarterly earnings of $0.76 per share, but said that figure included a $0.12 per share gain, shown as other income, on the sale of marketing rights for Ceclor CD and Keftab to Dura Pharmaceuticals Inc.
Shares in the drugmaker were up 2-1/4 to 71.

The First Call consensus of 20 analysts' estimates forecast third-quarter Lilly earnings of $0.64 per share. Earnings in the year-ago period were $0.54 per share, excluding gains of $1.60 per share on discontinued operations.

Lilly also said this year's third-quarter results were boosted by a lower number of shares outstanding -- 546.4 million versus 573 million a year earlier -- and by a lower estimated effective tax rate.
